meanings.definition: A framed opening, as in a wall, through which a window or door is set.
meanings.sent1: The viewport in the wall allowed fresh air to flow into the room.
meanings.sent2: I peeked through the viewport in the door to see who was knocking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat squeezed through the small viewport in the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a viewport into her soul, revealing all her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The viewport in the wall framed a picturesque view of the garden.

meanings.definition: The area of a computer screen where a user can view information.
meanings.sent1: The game character moved towards the edge of the viewport.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the settings to enlarge the viewport for better visibility.
meanings.sent3: The busy worker had multiple tabs open in his tiny viewport.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vast viewport, absorbing all the data on the screen.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors on the screen popped out of the viewport.
